places.generalDescription: Summersalt Beach Club, located at Jumeirah Al Naseem Hotel, is a hidden gem offering an all-encompassing day escape. For a fee, guests can enjoy access to the pool and stunning beach while indulging in beachside bites and signature beverages. The vibrant atmosphere is enhanced by guest and resident DJs playing tunes for the crowd. Additionally, Summersalt offers two enticing restaurants serving Peruvian and Asian cuisine for a delightful dining experience.

sources.snippet: One of the more exclusive beach clubs in Dubai, an afternoon spent at Summersalt is as much about the food as it is about the sun-worshipping, so we suggest you arrive hungry. Divided into two equally enticing restaurants – one Peruvian and one Asian – fill up on some great grub before retiring to your cabana for an afternoon snooze. Mon-Thu Dhs500 (Dhs250 redeemable), Fri-Sun Dhs500 (non-redeemable) or Dhs800 (Dhs400 redeemable).
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Dubai: 30 of the best revealed

sources.snippet: Enjoy unparalleled views of the sail-shaped Burj Al Arab set against a backdrop of blue sea and skies at Jumeirah Al Naseem's Summersalt beach club. Housed in one of Dubai’s most luxurious resorts at the  Madinat Jumeirah complex, Summersalt has made quite the splash in Dubai’s must-see scene. Here you'll find relaxing loungers, pool and beach access, and delicious cuisine inspired by the spice route.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubai in 2024

places.name: Summersalt Beach Club

reviews.text: Hussain (I think that is how you spell his name) gave us amazing service at the beach. The salads, sushi and club sandwich were delicious as well. Vibes were chill, nice atmosphere and great views. Will definitely come back!

Summersalt Beach Club is an absolute gem in Dubai! We've been coming here for five years now, and it continues to impress us every single time. From the moment we arrive, the service is impeccable-attentive, friendly, and always with a smile. The setting is breathtaking, with uninterrupted views of the Burj Al Arab and a beautifully maintained private beach that feels exclusive and serene.

It's also wonderfully child-friendly. The staff are always so welcoming to families, and the relaxed, luxurious atmosphere makes it easy for both adults and children to enjoy a perfect beach day.

A very special thank you to Rana and his incredible team for consistently going above and beyond to make our visits feel so special. Their warmth, professionalism, and attention to detail are what keep us coming back year after year.

Whether you're lounging by the pool, enjoying cocktails by the sea, or indulging in the outstanding food (the sushi is a must!), every part of the experience is thoughtfully curated and truly memorable.

Summersalt is, without a doubt, one of the highlights of every Dubai trip for us. We can't wait to return again soon!

We have been to Jumeirah Nassim for other restaurants and this was our 1st to summersalt. It's a perfect place to spend the day at the beach while enjoying good food, and beautiful views.
I loved everything about the place.

places.address: Jumeirah Al Naseem, Madinat Jumeirah, Jumeira St, Umm Suqeim 3 - Dubai, United Arab Emirates

places.generalDescription: Jumeira Public Beach, affectionately known as Nessnass Beach by the locals, is a stunning coastal gem that perfectly marries Dubai's urban skyline with the soothing embrace of nature. This beach offers an idyllic setting for both relaxation and adventure, making it a favorite among families and water sports enthusiasts alike. With its pristine sands and inviting waters, visitors can unwind or engage in thrilling activities like kitesurfing and windsurfing.

sources.snippet: Continuing north, past Dubai Canal, you’ll reach what Google labels as Jumeirah Public Beach, which overlooks Jumeirah Bay Island, home to one of Dubai’s most luxurious resorts, Bulgari Dubai and its Yacht Club, a millionaire’s lunch spot. Insider tip: At the northern end of the beach lies the quaint Jumeirah Fishing Harbour, home to homegrown, award-winning Asian eatery 3Fils and its sister restaurant BRIX Desserts. For a delicious lunch, order a Wagyu sando in the former and finish with a fancy cake in the latter.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Dubai

sources.snippet: Thanks to high-visibility smart poles, lifeguards are able to perform their duty until midnight in the Umm Suqeim neighbourhood next to the Burj Al Arab. Swimmers are allowed to venture 30 metres (100 feet) deep into the water and across 125 metres (410 feet) of land under supervision. It’s one the perfect public beaches in Dubai over the summer months, when it’s too hot enjoy the water during daylight hours.
sources.shortName: Best Public Beaches In Dubai

sources.snippet: The Jumeirah Public Beach, lovingly called Nessnass Beach by locals, has become a popular hotspot thanks to its welcoming waters and clean stretch of sand. Whether you’re looking for a laidback day out with the family or want to practice your kitesurfing or windsurfing flips and dips, this is the place to be. If you’d like to hone  your watersports skills, head over to the Kite n Surf kiosk where you can sign up for lessons or equipment rentals for kitesurfing, paddleboarding and kayaking, with group bookings also available.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubai in 2024

sources.snippet: Jumeirah Public Beach, also known as Nessnass Beach, has become a popular hotspot. With a night swimming option, allowing you to cool off even after sunset, it’s got plenty to do — including kite surfing, paddleboarding and kayaking. While it might be as facilitated as other beaches in Dubai, it does promise a nice day out, with nearby eateries like 3Fils and BRIX Cafe conveniently located at Jumeirah Fishing Harbour.
sources.shortName: 10 of the best beaches in Dubai for fun in the sun

sources.snippet: Jumeirah Public Beach, or simply Jumeirah Beach, is one of the most popular beaches in Dubai and has been awarded the 'Blue Flag Beach' certification for adhering to strict international standards. The beach is an ideal family picnic spot, with round-the-clock lifeguard service and sports facilities. There is no entry fee to access the beach.
sources.shortName: Best Beautiful public Beaches in Dubai

places.name: Jumeira Public Beach

reviews.text: It was a cool experience! The sea is calm and the water is clean... I don't recommend going in the summer, as there are no umbrellas and the sea gets very hot, other than that there are plenty of things to do around and good restaurants

Jumeirah Public Beach at La Mer was a stunning spot to enjoy with my fiancé. The beach itself is beautiful and peaceful, offering a relaxing escape without the usual crowds. The calm atmosphere made it feel like we had a private getaway right by the water.

Though 90% of the area feels somewhat abandoned, that added to the charm. It was like exploring a hidden gem with a unique blend of open space, art installations, and beach vibes. The untouched areas make for great photo spots and an enjoyable walk around the site, with views you wouldn't usually find in a busier setting.

Overall, Jumeirah Public Beach in La Mer is perfect for anyone looking for a quieter beach experience and some scenic, off-the-beaten-path exploration.

Getting to Jumeirah Open Beach is easy. Get on Sheikh Zayed Road (E11). Follow it towards Al Thanya Street. Continue to 2 C Street. You can drive here or take a bus as well. The beach is accessible by several public transport buses.

And that brings an end to our review of Jumeirah Public Beach, one of the frequently visited beaches in the UAE. Enrich your holiday experience by visiting other beaches in the city. Stop by La Mer Beach, a drive-up spot in Dubai, for beach hangout or check out the JBR beach activities in the city.

If you fancy driving out of Dubai to a popular beach destination, Dibba Beach in Fujairah could be an excellent choice.

places.address: Jumeirah - Jumeirah 1 - Dubai, United Arab Emirates
